title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string such as '55/66/9999' is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. As a result, the following definition shows up in the report design:<parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters> Two problems can be observed here:
EB: When an invalid date/time value is entered in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, the system should reject the invalid value and display an error message. The report design should not contain any definition or XML code related to the invalid date/time value.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open BIRT report designer. 
2. Create a new report. 
3. Add a new report parameter of 'DateTime' type. 
4. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date/time value (e.g., '55/66/9999'). 
5. Save the report design. 
6. Open the report design file and check if the invalid value is accepted and present in the definition.
